I played this game a long time ago when it was a free weekend. I enjoyed it but didn't buy it.  Bought alot of games since then that sucked and always thought man I wish i would have bought that Dead by Daylight that was a good game.  Well I finally bought it a week or so ago and am enjoying it.  I think it will be a game i can keep in my steam library that I can come back to from time to time and get away so to speak and have fun.  Anyways, my 2 cents peace out thumbs up :P

As of August 2020, Dead by Daylight has been in my library for over 3 years. I've spent close to 150 hours (As of this review) playing DbD and the game has experienced multiple changes from where it originated. First, I simply can't recommend this game due to the reasons listed below.

1.) Survivors are consistantly nerfed.
2.) Matchmaking queue's are terribly long and takes, at least, 5-10 minutes to find a match (Killer & Survivor). Even though active players show 30k+ players active within the game.
3.) Monetizing In-game purchases EVERYWHERE! (DLC, In-game store purchases, & tier scaling system.)

I want to love DbD, but after coming back to the game in 2020, I simply cannot recommend it due to these reasons. The game has become a hot bed of toxic players.

This game keeps you at the edge of your seat at all times. But if you are a survivor and are cordnated with the rest of your team you can wipe the floor with the hunter it is all about the skill you have and not so much of the charcter and perk you have.
Personally i love and hate this game, you know your into a game when no matter how frustrurated you get (from losing) you just cant stop playing it because you love it.
The game is good, but the devs are shit, tons of paywalls and P2W cancer.
